name: 陳雅玫
objective: The course introduces the major approaches in translation theory and lays emphasis on their application to English-Chinese translation practice. Students will be provided with a comprehensive overview of the discipline of translation studies, raising their awareness of both the diversity of possible approaches to translation and the relationships between these approaches. Through the translation and commentary essays submitted for this course, the students will learn to think critically about and be more conscious of their own translation practice.
schedule:
Week 1   (1) course introduction; (2) overview of the discipline of translation studies; (3)  areas in translation research
Week 2   linguistically oriented theories (1)
Week 3   linguistically oriented theories (2)
Week 4   linguistically oriented theories (3)
Week 5   functionalist approaches (1)
Week 6   functionalist approaches (2)
Week 7   functionalist approaches (3)
Week 8   discourse and register analysis
Week 9   descriptive translation studies (1)
Week 10  descriptive translation studies (2)
Week 11  cultural and ideological turns (1)
Week 12  cultural and ideological turns (2)
Week 13  news translation
Week 14  audio-visual translation
Week 15  Chinese translation theories (1)
Week 16   Chinese translation theories (2)
Week 17  research proposal presentation
Week 18  in class group translation projects
scorePolicy:
1. attendance & participation: 15%
2. oral presentations and reflections: 30%
3. one translation/commentary task and one group translation project: 25%
4. research proposal (including proposal presentation): 30%
